text: <@U7SL518D6> Hi, im coming back with this topic. We right now work with the CLI and local SASS Files which we output into CSS. Our team right now has no experience with command line and GitHub. Do you have any advice. How to work in this environment? We all ned the same SASS Files locally all the time to create the CSS output.
It would be so cool to have the SASS Files on Hbuspot

I would recommend using git to commit your SASS files so everyone in the team has the same files.

You said your team doesn't have experience with git, thankfully github has a GUI version you can use. <https://desktop.github.com/|https://desktop.github.com/>
Personally i use git in the command line and in VS Code, but it's not as friendly to a beginner.

As for learning github, there are a ton of great resources available <https://lab.github.com/|https://lab.github.com/>
I highly encourage learning to work with version control systems like git it makes working on projects with others so much easier, and it's knowledge that will stay useful for you for nearly any platform your team builds for.

As far as SASS, you can either install it with the command line or use a GUI tool like CodeKit.
Optionally instead of SASS you can use HubL in your .css files(except for module.css but there's a way to have instance specific css still)

The main thing that SASS gives you that HubL doesnt is just the CSS selector nesting. 

Hubl supports variables, math, macros, loops, resize_image_url, includes etc. Which basically gives you almost everything SASS gets you plus extras. Best part? No one needs to set it up locally, all of the processing happens server side on our end.
Hello everyone, is there an easy understandable tutorial to connect GitHub and HubSpot to the share template data?
<@U7SL518D6> We would really like to use SASS because the nesting is something we all really like.
<@U7SL518D6> We stil work on this and hope we can fix it.
So install sass and run it or use a GUI tool like codekit as I noted above which puts a GUI layer on top of the set up of sass
codekit + github app + good commit comments + good communication with team
Clarifying that us recommending codekit is our personal recommendations for this situation, HubSpot does not have any official connection to CodeKit.
